content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-094-10-B
|Item_parent=Rachialgia
|Item_parent_short=Rachialgia
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the other causes of secondary spinal pain
|Description=Description and list of aetiologies
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=Bisseriex Hélène,Nguyen Christelle
|Order=10}}

'''Autres ÉTIOLOGIES ''(rang B)''' des rachialgies secondaires :''''

o chondrocalcinosis, apatite rheumatism (peri-odontoid or disc calcifications), rheumatoid arthritis ''[[Discovery of a bone and joint abnormality on medical imaging examination SDD-228|(discovery of a bone and joint abnormality on medical imaging examination)]''''

o neurological: intrarachid or posterior fossa tumour (neck pain)

o referred pain of ENT or anterior cervical origin (cervicalgia) ''[[Discovery of a cervico-facial anomaly on medical imaging examination SDD-225|(discovery of a cervico-facial anomaly on medical imaging examination)]]''''

question.title: What are some other causes of secondary spinal pain?
question.description: List the other aetiologies of secondary spinal pain

option_a.title: Osteoporosis
option_a.description: A condition characterized by a decrease in bone mass and density

option_b.title: Chondrocalcinosis
option_b.description: A condition characterized by the accumulation of calcium pyrophosphate dihydrate crystals in the cartilage

option_c.title: Referred pain of ENT origin
option_c.description: Pain referred from the ears, nose, and throat

option_d.title: Intrarachid tumour
option_d.description: A type of tumour that occurs within the space surrounding the brain and spinal cord

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the option
